Description: Fragment (neck) of small pottery flask with trefoil mouth and an annular ridge around the middle of the neck, two added clay buttons on either side of the spout, suggesting eyes, as well as two patches of clay under the spout and at the base of the front part of the neck. Part of the handle is also preserved behind the neck. The rear part of the rim is broken and missing.
Curator's comments: See W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 74 § 71: "A curious little neck of a vase drab pottery is distinctly Greek and not Egyptian (pl. xl, 3)".
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 74 § 71, pl. xl, 3)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.107, p.220, pl.62)
